overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a practical approach to time-series forecasting with limited historical points (96 hours). The model prioritizes simplicity and interpretability, opting for a daily-seasonality-based averaging method over complex statistical models due to data constraints. It carefully considers data characteristics like missing value handling and pattern stability while acknowledging limitations in capturing weekly patterns or trends with only 4 days of data.
key_insights: Prioritization of daily seasonality for hourly data with explicit periodicity handling
Explicit trade-off analysis between model complexity and overfitting risks with limited data
Consideration of weighted averaging for recency bias before rejecting due to absent trends
Meticulous data validation (missing values, decimal precision, date sequencing)
Recognition of weekly pattern detection limitations with short historical data
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with strong emphasis on data constraints: Starts with advanced model considerations (SARIMA/Exponential Smoothing) but simplifies to heuristic averaging after evaluating data limitations. Includes multi-step validation, pattern analysis, and implementation details while maintaining computational feasibility.
